noun.description: A previous statement or proposition from which another is inferred or follows as a conclusion.
examples: if the premise is true, then the conclusion must be true

verb.description: Base an argument, theory, or undertaking on.
examples: the reforms were premised on our findings

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French premisse, from medieval Latin praemissa (propositio) (proposition) set in front, from Latin praemittere, from prae before + mittere send.
